title: Build a Name Greeter with Riverpod
description: Create a simple app where users type their name in a TextField and see 'Hello, {name}!' update in real-time using Riverpod state management.
instructions:
Complete the following tasks:

1. Create a StateProvider<String> called nameProvider with an empty string as the initial value
2. Wrap the app in ProviderScope
3. Create a ConsumerWidget called GreeterScreen
4. Add a TextField that updates nameProvider when the user types
5. Display 'Hello, {name}!' that updates in real-time as the user types
6. If the name is empty, display 'Hello, stranger!'

Remember:
- Use ref.watch() in the build method to get the name for display
- Use ref.read() in the onChanged callback to update the provider
- The TextField needs a TextEditingController for proper behavior

testCases.description: Greeting shows 'stranger' when empty, name when filled

hints.text: StateProvider is created like this: final nameProvider = StateProvider<String>((ref) => ''); The (ref) => '' part returns the initial value (empty string).
To update a StateProvider, use ref.read(nameProvider.notifier).state = newValue. The .notifier gives you access to the state setter.
ConsumerWidget's build method has TWO parameters: (BuildContext context, WidgetRef ref). The ref is what you use to watch and read providers.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using ref.read() instead of ref.watch() in build method
commonMistakes.consequence: UI does not update when the name changes
commonMistakes.correction: Use ref.watch(nameProvider) in the build method. watch() subscribes to changes, read() does not.

commonMistakes.consequence: Creates unnecessary subscriptions and potential performance issues
commonMistakes.correction: Use ref.read(nameProvider.notifier).state = value in callbacks. read() is for one-time access.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to wrap app in ProviderScope
commonMistakes.consequence: Runtime error: Bad state: No ProviderScope found
commonMistakes.correction: In main(), wrap your app: runApp(ProviderScope(child: MyApp()))

commonMistakes.consequence: No ref parameter available, cannot access providers
commonMistakes.correction: Change 'extends StatelessWidget' to 'extends ConsumerWidget' and add WidgetRef ref parameter
